content.question:
<math alttext="g of x equals, x squared plus 1, for x less than 3; and g of x equals, 13 minus x, for x greater than or equal to 3." overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mo>{</mo> <mtable columnalign="left" rowspacing="1.5ex" width="auto"> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <mrow> <mtext>for</mtext> <mspace> </mspace> <mspace width="0.45em"> </mspace> <mi>x</mi> <mo><</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mn>13</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <mrow> <mtext>for</mtext> <mspace> </mspace> <mspace width="0.45em"> </mspace> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≥</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

Let <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given above. What is the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 5, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
